Title: Primary SBMS Memory Layout
Description: reference source for the system data_tables

notes1: zmap means there is a 1:1 relationship almost the rack_inc for sbmu:hold is 1000:1000  the rack_inc for rtos:hold arrives thanks to use rack_mem
notes2: so when we do a modbus query for "sbmu:hold:at_total_v_over"  it is zero mapped to "rtos:hold:at_total_v_over"
notes3: here is the code that does that setIdOffset("sbmu:hold:at_total_v_over",getIdOffset("rtos:hold:at_total_v_over");
notes4: the trick is getting the rack number , for offsets 1000->1199 its register 500

items.name: close_all_racks
items.note: fractal set to one to close all racks

items.name: open_all_racks
items.note: fractal set to one to open all racks

items.name: close_rack
items.note: fractal set to one to close one rack

items.name: open_rack
items.note: fractal set to one to open one rack

note: These are all help in the ops database not in shared memory, they are all ints
